result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10-28-2014 Plea Hearing.

Defendant Rodney C Miller in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Rodney C Miller in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Pl to Cts 2, 3 & 4 in 14CF192, Ct 1 is DRI as well as 14CF907 and 14CM1062. It is a stipulated agreement - w/held sent-2 1/2 yrs prob-6 mos RCJ, CFTS and balance stayed, no contact w/victim, AODA/FT. The State agrees not to file further BJ charges.
P-NC to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Defense asks that bond me modified and the State has no objection

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered. Modify bond in 14CF192 to signature bond - same terms and conditions  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Rodney C Miller in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Rodney C Miller in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for Ms. Sommers for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Previous bond of $1,500.00 cash has been forfeited by a previous court. Defense is asking that this Court to vacate the forfeiture and convert it to signature bond.
Defense is asking for the aggregate bond to be reduced to $1,500.00 cash. The State objects citing deft's inability to appear in court.

BTC: Bond modification is denied
To Join the following cases:  14CM1062, 14CF192, 14CF907
Bail/bond hearing on September 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
ATTY Tran files petition for review of bail.
for review of bail

Defendant Rodney C Miller in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Rodney C Miller in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
The State indicates they have received a bond motion from the defense. The Court does not have said motion and the State provided the Court with theirs.
Defense asks that bond be amended to a co-signature bond with Bertha Miller. The Court conducts a colloquy with Ms. Miller regarding bond. 
The State objects to bond modification citing deft's previous BJ charges and previous failures to appear in court.

BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bonds to be set at $5,000.00 - $1,500.00 cash and balance by co-signature with Bertha Miller in both cases in total.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 09:30 am.

AS WELL AS $1,750.00 CO-SIGNATURE BOND WITH BERTHA MILLER, DOB________________ WITH PHOTO ID. Ct 1: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ; Ct 2: 946.41(1)-Obstructing. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
ATTY Tran files petition for review of bail
